title: Jack Walkington
text:
John "Jack" Christopher Walkington (3 March 1909 – May 1997) was an English <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1920s, 1930s and 1940s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Burley%20RUFC">Burley RUFC</a> (in <a href="Burley%2C%20Leeds">Burley, Leeds</a>), and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a>, and at club level for <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet</a> (<a href="Captain%20%28sports%29">captain</a>), and <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley</a> (<a href="World%20War%20II">World War II</a> <a href="Loan%20%28sports%29">guest</a>), as a , i.e. number 1.
Background.
Jack Walkington was born in <a href="Kirkstall">Kirkstall</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, <a href="West%20Riding%20of%20Yorkshire">West Riding of Yorkshire</a>, England, he worked as a <a href="Cabinetry">cabinet maker</a>, he owned a <a href="furniture">furniture</a> shop adjacent to the <a href="Barley%20Mow%2C%20Bramley">Barley Mow, Bramley</a>, the home ground of rugby league club; <a href="Bramley%20RLFC">Bramley</a>, and he died aged 88 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, <a href="West%20Yorkshire">West Yorkshire</a>, England.
Playing career.
International honours.
Jack Walkington won <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a>s for <a href="England%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">England</a> (RL) while at Hunslet in 1930 against <a href="Other%20Nationalities%20rugby%20league%20team">Other Nationalities</a>, in 1931 against Wales, in 1938 against Wales, and in 1944 against Wales.
Championship Final appearances.
Jack Walkington played , and scored a <a href="drop%20goal">drop goal</a> in <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet</a>'s 8-2 victory over <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1937%E2%80%9338%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1937–38 season</a> at <a href="Elland%20Road">Elland Road</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 30 April 1938.
County Cup Final appearances.
Jack Walkington played in the <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet FC</a>'s 7-13 defeat by <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1929–30</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1929–30 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 30 November 1929, in front of a crowd of 11,000.
Club career.
Jack Walkington made his début for <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet</a> against <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> on Saturday 19 March 1927, he scored 11-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">goals</a>, and 1-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">try</a> for 25-points against <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> on Wednesday 29 April 1931, and scored 119-<a href="Try%20%28rugby%29">goals</a> in <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet</a>'s victory in the <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20League">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1931%E2%80%9332%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1931–32 season</a>. During Jack Walkington's time at Hunslet, they were losing finalists in three <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Finals; the 7-13 defeat by <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> in the <a href="1929%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1929</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1929%E2%80%9330%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1929–30 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 30 November 1929, the 2-4 defeat by <a href="Huddersfield%20Giants">Huddersfield</a> in the <a href="1931%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1931</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1931%E2%80%9332%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1931–32 season</a> at <a href="Headingley%20Stadium%23Rugby%20ground">Headingley</a> <a href="Headingley%20Rugby%20Stadium">Rugby Stadium</a>, <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> on Saturday 21 November 1931, and the 3-14 (3-12 at <a href="Parkside%2C%20Hunslet">Parkside, Hunslet</a> on Saturday 2 December 1944, and 0-2 at <a href="Thrum%20Hall">Thrum Hall</a>, <a href="Halifax%2C%20West%20Yorkshire">Halifax</a> on Saturday 9 December 1944) aggregate defeat by <a href="Halifax%20R.L.F.C.">Halifax</a> in the <a href="1944%20Yorkshire%20Cup">1944</a> <a href="RFL%20Yorkshire%20Cup">Yorkshire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1944%E2%80%9345%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20Wartime%20Emergency%20League%20season">1944–45 Wartime Emergency League season</a>. Jack Walkington made his début for <a href="Batley%20Bulldogs">Batley</a> against <a href="Bradford%20Bulls">Bradford Northern</a> at <a href="Odsal%20Stadium">Odsal Stadium</a>, <a href="Bradford">Bradford</a> on Saturday 6 February 1943, and he played and scored 3-<a href="Goal%20%28sport%29%23Rugby%20football">goal</a>s in the 12-15 defeat by <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> at <a href="Mount%20Pleasant%2C%20Batley">Mount Pleasant</a>, <a href="Batley">Batley</a> on Saturday 13 February 1943.
Testimonial match.
Jack Walkington's <a href="Testimonial%20match">Testimonial match</a> at <a href="Hunslet%20F.C.%20%281883%29">Hunslet</a> took place against <a href="Hull%20Kingston%20Rovers">Hull Kingston Rovers</a> on Saturday 1 January 1938.
Genealogical information.
Jack Walkington's marriage to Ada E. (<a href="Given%20name%23Name%20at%20birth">née</a> Clay) was registered during third ¼ 1931 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> North district. They had children; Barbara Walkington (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3D4ljyHkUp7wZtJbxRl8EJgg%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during second ¼ 1934 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> North district), John G. Walkington (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DVxq3Our0p3z%252B%252Fy1ZRek%252Bgg%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during third ¼ 1936 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> North district), Christopher R. Walkington (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DHY7RH%252FOYUWj2nJCoPsUFvw%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during fourth ¼ 1937 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> North district), and Dorothy J. Walkington (<a href="http%3A//www.freebmd.org.uk/cgi/information.pl%3Fcite%3DldBxipCryKs29HbWypIaAw%26amp%3Bscan%3D1">birth registered</a> during fourth ¼ 1942 in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a> district).
